page.title: 10SANDOWN-2
page.content: To land at the airport you have to pay a fee of Â£5 and to keep your plane in a hanger you have to pay Â£60-Â£70 a month, but if you have a plane with wings that fold up it costs less because it takes up less space. Two hangers at the airport are for keeping planes in (they are owned by Evergreen Holdings) the other two are for building planes. These are privately owned. They have about 35 planes at the airport and 35 have been built there. Some of these planes are used for pleasure flights taking tourists around the island on different routes. Occasionally V.I.P.'s land at the airport. This year on May 30th {PRINCESS DIANA}came to the island by helicopter arriving in a field in Ryde and leaving from Sandown Airport. My dad is a local General Practitioner.
